meanings.definition: The action of finding new people to join an organization or support a cause.
meanings.sent1: The recruitments for the charity event brought in many volunteers.
meanings.sent2: The company's recruitments for skilled workers were successful.
meanings.sent3: The recruitments for the bake sale were so popular, they ran out of cookies!
meanings.sent4: Her recruitments for the school play were like gathering stars for a bright constellation.
meanings.sent5: The recruitments for the beach cleanup made the shore sparkle with new helpers.

meanings.definition: The process of enlisting or hiring new employees or members.
meanings.sent1: Recruitments for the job positions will begin next week.
meanings.sent2: The recruitments for the club attracted many enthusiastic members.
meanings.sent3: The recruitments for the dance team had everyone showing off their moves.
meanings.sent4: His recruitments for the project team were like assembling a winning puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The recruitments for the book club made reading even more enjoyable with new friends.

meanings.definition: The act of seeking to persuade someone to join a company or organization.
meanings.sent1: Her recruitments for the sales team were very convincing.
meanings.sent2: The recruitments for the student council were met with great interest.
meanings.sent3: The recruitments for the debate team turned arguments into fun discussions.
meanings.sent4: His recruitments for the band were like composing a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The recruitments for the gardening club bloomed with new members eager to plant.
